title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 701.9 - Fees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 701.9 - Fees

State Regulations
(a) Unless
otherwise allowed by statute, no fee will be charged for: (1)
inspecting records; (2)
searching for records; or
(3)
any certification pursuant to this

Part. (b) Unless
otherwise allowed by statute, copies of records shall be provided: (1)
at a minimum rate of 25 cents per
photocopy up to 8 1/2 x 14 inches; or
(2)
upon payment of the actual cost of
reproduction, if the record or personal information cannot readily be
photocopied on machinery owned or leased by the commission or if outside
contractors are required to copy the record involved. (c) The commission, at its discretion, may, in instances it deems appropriate, waive any fee or provide records at lower
fees. The data subject will be notified if such a waiver or reduction in fees
has been granted. However, when records are provided for less than the fee
allowed by law, a waiver or reduction shall be deemed to have been granted. A
waiver or reduction granted to any data subject or in response to any
particular request shall not require the commission to grant any further waiver
or reduction in fees with respect to any other data subject or
request. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
701.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
